title: How to Make Butterbeer

steps.headline: Mix the cream, butter, sugar and spices together.
Beat in the vanilla ice cream until the combination is thoroughly mixed.
Re-freeze the mixture.
steps.description: Place it in the freezer until it's firm.

steps.headline: Scoop out the frozen mixture into a glass.
Pour hot Apple cider over the ice cream mixture.
Melt the butter in a saucepan.
Mix in the butterscotch.
Pour the mixture into a large bowl.
Carefully add the club soda.
Ladle the butterbeer into serving glasses.
Boil the sugar and water.
steps.description: Place a saucepan over medium heat. Add the sugar and water and bring them to a boil. Stir the mixture until the temperature reaches 240 degrees. Check the temperature frequently with a candy thermometer.

steps.headline: Stir in the butter, salt, and 1/4 cup of cream.
Set the mixture aside to cool.
Stir in the rum once the mixture has cooled.
Beat 2 tablespoons of the cooled mixture with the remaining cream.
steps.description: Transfer the remaining cream to a mixing bowl. Measure out 2 tablespoons of the cooled mixture, and add it to the cream. Beat together until the cream is fluffy and whipped.

steps.headline: Pour equal parts of the caramel butter mixture into four glasses.
Top the glasses off with cream soda and stir.
Add whipped cream.

methods.name: Making Cold Butter Beer For Children

steps.headline: Stir butter with cinnamon, white sugar, and vanilla extract in a mixing bowl.
Blend that mixture with vanilla ice cream, apple cider, and cream soda in a blender.
Pour into glasses and top with whipped cream and caramel.
steps.description: This will make a tasty treat of 6 servings.
